summary.name: Muhammad Saif ur Rehman
summary.title: Simulation Engineer | CFD & FEA Specialist
summary.description: A Simulation Engineer with deep interest in multiphase flow simulations and their applications across complex engineering systems. Skilled in advanced CAE tools, automation with Python, and core development in C++. Experienced in CFD/FEA modeling, optimization, and workflow automation with strong problem-solving and leadership abilities.

education.institution: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)
education.description: Specialization in Finite Element Analysis (FEA), Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), and Numerical Methods. Additional courses in Vehicle Design, Mechatronics, and Gas Turbines.

education.institution: School of Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering (SMME), NUST
education.description: Covered fundamentals to advanced CFD including meshing, solvers, turbulence modeling, multiphase flows, solver customization, and scripting.

experience.title: Simulation Engineer
experience.description: Working in Simulation and Development department with focus on material modeling, workflow automation, and optimization.
responsibilities: Integrated classical material models into MATLAB and Python as user subroutines for industrial FEA solvers.
Developed workflows to validate material models against experimental and simulation data.
Managed a comprehensive material database of 200+ material types from 300+ suppliers.
Designed and implemented 10+ simulation workflows for testing, data parsing, meshing, and post-processing.
Developed shape optimization framework in Python and C++ using adjoint sensitivities.
Maintained code quality with GitHub CI/CD pipelines and modular development.

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.company: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)
experience.description: Conducted research in nanofluids-based heat transfer enhancement and ventilated super-cavitation.
responsibilities: Enhanced nanofluid solar collector heat transfer efficiency up to 70% using artificial roughness.
Demonstrated that increasing Air-Al₂O₃ volume fraction (1% to 4%) doubled heat transfer rate.
Developed ventilated super-cavitation model reducing drag by 65%.
Optimized cavitator design achieving 5% additional drag reduction with disk cavitator.
Reduced computational time using ANSYS Fluent MPI on HPC clusters.

experience.title: Freelance CAE Engineer
experience.description: Delivered freelance projects in CFD and FEA modeling.
responsibilities: Built numerical models and discretization schemes.
Developed multiphase flow and turbulence models.

experience.title: Maintenance Engineer - Intern
experience.description: Worked in maintenance engineering and plant operations.
responsibilities: Reviewed 100+ work permits, inspection reports, and P&IDs across 10+ departments.
Implemented API, ASTM, ANSI, ISO standards on 20+ rotary and stationary equipment.
Supervised team of 10+ in overhaul of Naphtha Hydro pump.
Proposed AI-based workload planning mechanism reducing field time by 30%.

projects.title: Dental Zirconia Fixed Prosthesis (FEA)
projects.description: Analyzed effect of cement thickness and Young’s modulus on stress distribution in zirconia dental prosthesis. Optimized adhesive thickness improved clinical service by 35%.

projects.title: Vortex Shedding in Underwater Circular Cylinders
projects.description: Validated RANS SST k-ω turbulent model for vortex-induced vibrations at Re=10000 with <15% error margin.

projects.title: AgroDrone Project
projects.description: Led a team of 8 to design UAV for targeted pesticide spraying. Finalist in FICS Stage 3 startup pitching competition.

volunteering.title: Lead Blood Donation Drive
volunteering.description: Led team of 8 volunteers, collected 25+ pints of blood for Thalassemia patients during COVID-19.

volunteering.title: Educating Underprivileged Children
volunteering.description: Provided foundational education to underprivileged children in slum areas, enabling integration into formal education system.

interests: Badminton (8+ years, University Team Player, Inter-School Semifinalist)
